pr_title: CAM-11665: make integration tests run on Unix systems

timeline.message:
fix(run): make integration tests run on Unix systems

- avoids copying the unpacked run distribution into the test classpath
  via the maven resources plugin
- copying lost the file permissions for the startup scripts,
  so the integration tests failed

timeline.bodyText: Why this change from assertj to hamcrest?
timeline.author: ThorbenLindhauer

replies.bodyText:
I (only vaguely, to be honest) remember that we had an issue in the EE repo with this test because the assertj dependency wasn't present there somehow. Miklas used it "by accident" and was fine with using hamcrest here because that's on the classpath already. Makes the build easier, I would say.
We could also investigate on why it didn't work in the EE repo but I think it's not worth the effort for that one assertion right now.
Thoughts on this?
replies.author: tmetzke

replies.bodyText: I think we should try to make assertj work. Assertj is our go-to library for assertions. The next person that writes a test here will run into the same problem again and it looks like the root cause is not easy to understand.
replies.author: ThorbenLindhauer

replies.bodyText: I'll have a look and update here with insights
replies.author: tmetzke

replies.bodyText: OK, using assertj again, the EE module now adds a dependency to assertj as well 👍
replies.author: tmetzke

timeline.message:
* keep using assertj
* make dependency to assertj explicit
* use camunda-parent compatible assertj version
